title: Euphoria Might End With Season 3, HBO Drama Boss Hints
description: High school can’t last forever, and Euphoria might be ready to graduate. The upcoming (and much-delayed) third season of HBO’s acclaimed teen drama may be its last, the network’s head of drama Francesca Orsi tells our sister site Deadline. “We’ve talked about it, I don’t think anything is over until it’s over, but it’s been […]
author: Dave Nemetz
excerpt: 'Euphoria' might be ready to graduate: The HBO drama's upcoming third season may be its last.
text: Euphoria Might End With Season 3, HBO Drama Boss HintsHigh school can’t last forever, and Euphoria might be ready to graduate. The upcoming (and much-delayed) third season of HBO‘s acclaimed teen drama may be its last, the network’s head of drama Francesca Orsi tells our sister site Deadline. “We’ve talked about it, I don’t think anything is over until it’s over, but it’s been discussed that this is the end,” Orsi admits. But she thinks fans “will be very satisfied with this season, and how we bring each of the characters’ whole narrative.” Euphoria stars Emmy winner Zendaya as Rue Bennett, a recovering drug addict who struggles to stay sober while attending high school in California. Along with Zendaya, the cast features rising stars like Sydney Sweeney and Jacob Elordi, so it’s understandably been difficult to coordinate everyone’s schedule to shoot a new season. Season 2 last aired in February 2022, so we’re expected to see a time jump when Euphoria returns for Season 3, with the cast now out of high school. Since it last aired, cast member Barbie Ferreira (aka Kat) announced her exit, and Angus Cloud (who played Fez) tragically died of a drug overdose. The eight-episode Season 3 — which began filming earlier this month — is slated to premiere on HBO in 2026. Do you want Euphoria to keep going, or do you think it should end next season? Give us your thoughts in the comments. Euphoria Season 3: Everything We Know So Far
html:
Euphoria Might End With Season 3, HBO Drama Boss Hints

High school can’t last forever, and Euphoria might be ready to graduate.

The upcoming (and much-delayed) third season of HBO‘s acclaimed teen drama may be its last, the network’s head of drama Francesca Orsi tells our sister site Deadline. “We’ve talked about it, I don’t think anything is over until it’s over, but it’s been discussed that this is the end,” Orsi admits. But she thinks fans “will be very satisfied with this season, and how we bring each of the characters’ whole narrative.”

Euphoria stars Emmy winner Zendaya as Rue Bennett, a recovering drug addict who struggles to stay sober while attending high school in California. Along with Zendaya, the cast features rising stars like Sydney Sweeney and Jacob Elordi, so it’s understandably been difficult to coordinate everyone’s schedule to shoot a new season.

Season 2 last aired in February 2022, so we’re expected to see a time jump when Euphoria returns for Season 3, with the cast now out of high school. Since it last aired, cast member Barbie Ferreira (aka Kat) announced her exit, and Angus Cloud (who played Fez) tragically died of a drug overdose. The eight-episode Season 3 — which began filming earlier this month — is slated to premiere on HBO in 2026.

Do you want Euphoria to keep going, or do you think it should end next season? Give us your thoughts in the comments.

Euphoria Season 3: Everything We Know So Far
